entry.title: Godalming (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the old town hall in Godalming, Surrey, is nicknamed "The Pepperpot" (pictured) after its distinctive cupola?

entry.title: KFC rice (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that KFC rice may have originated as a quick, cheap Christmas dinner, owing to the popularity of KFC in Japan?

entry.title: Mary Burt Messer (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Mary Burt Messer was researching and writing about the sociology of divorce as early as 1924?

entry.title: The Grudge (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that following the release of Olivia Rodrigo's song "The Grudge", fans speculated that it was about her supposed feud with Taylor Swift?

entry.title: Reichsgesetzblatt (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Reichsgesetzblatt was last issued five days before the Battle of Berlin began?

entry.title: an Illinois TV station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that employees resigned from an Illinois TV station after ownership decided there were too many people on the payroll?

entry.title: a T-shirt that was so offensive (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the heavy metal band Cradle of Filth released a T-shirt that was so offensive that several people were arrested for wearing it?

entry.title: The Sims 2: University (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that bugs reported during the development of The Sims 2: University included "zombies can't fall in love" and "zombies walk on water"?
